mlr3mbspls 0.2.12

Nested CV for unsupervised MB-sPLS

Source: R/mbspls_nested_cv.R
mbspls_nested_cv.Rd

Perform nested cross-validation for unsupervised multi-block sparse PLS (MB-sPLS) using a specified resampling strategy. This function tunes the model on inner folds and evaluates it on outer folds, returning a summary of results.

mbspls_nested_cv(
  task,
  graphlearner,
  rs_outer,
  rs_inner,
  ncomp,
  tuner_budget,
  tuning_early_stop = TRUE,
  performance_metric = c("mac", "frobenius"),
  val_test = c("none", "permutation", "bootstrap"),
  val_test_n = 1000L,
  val_test_alpha = 0.05,
  val_permute_all = TRUE,
  n_perm_tuning = 500L,
  perm_alpha_tuning = 0.05,
  store_payload = TRUE
)

Arguments

task

mlr3::Task with all pre-MBsPLS features.

graphlearner

mlr3pipelines::GraphLearner with a PipeOpMBsPLS node.

rs_outer

mlr3::Resampling instantiated (outer) resampling.

rs_inner

mlr3::Resampling template (inner) resampling.

ncomp

integer, max #components considered by the tuner.

tuner_budget

integer, #candidate evaluations per component.

tuning_early_stop

logical, stop tuning early if no sig. components.

performance_metric

"mac" or "frobenius" for the latent correlation.

val_test

"none", "permutation", or "bootstrap" - run on OUTER test.

val_test_n

integer, permutations/boot reps on OUTER test.

val_test_alpha

numeric, early-stop / CI level param for validation tests.

val_permute_all

logical, permute all blocks in test validation.

n_perm_tuning

integer, permutations used inside the tuner's early stop.

perm_alpha_tuning

numeric, tuner early-stop alpha (component-wise).

store_payload

logical, keep the full PipeOpMBsPLS predict payload.

Value

list with:

  • results: data.table with per-outer-split summary (inner_score, test MACs, etc.)

  • c_mats: list of tuned C* matrices per outer split

  • inner_scores: numeric vector of best inner-CV scores (one per outer split)

  • payloads: (optional) list of PipeOp logging payloads for each outer test

  • summary_table: data.table with aggregated metrics across outer splits
